sub_title: Director Strategy & Transactions | Technology and M&A
summary:
Hans is a senior director with over 25 years of experience in transforming business through IT, managing information for business performance, and selecting and deploying the enabling technologies. 

Hans' strengths are in collaborating with business and IT in defining and executing large change programs with standard software, hardware and infrastructure technology. Hans is an allround, people oriented IT professional, building up and managing expert teams and together deliver quality solutions in IT. 

Hans has core competences in the following domains:
- Idea to Market (I2M): PPIM (Project Portfolio & Innovation Management),
- Market to Order (M2O): Marketing (Pricing & Products, Digital), Sales (CRM, Pricing & Quoting, Channel Management / Distribution, B2B EDI integration), 
- Forecast to Plan (F2P): Demand Planning, Forecasting, Supply Chain planning
- Order to Cash (O2C): Order Management, B2B EDI, Fulfillment, Vendor Managed Inventory, Warehousing
- Quality Systems: Customer quality, Trace-ability, Product Change Notes, Complaint handling, Audits, Sustainability
- Digital Workplace: Desktop, Collaboration, Voice & Video, Printing, Event Management, Identity & Access Management, Security 
- Corporate Functions: Finance, HR, Global Business Shared Services, IT4IT through ServiceNow implementation 
- Mergers, Acquisitions and divestment programs, Day1, Day2 implementations, IT Temporary SLA board management
- Strategic IT programs: outsourcing, application decommissioning, savings programs, data center and network transitions to cloud

education.field_of_study: Logistics, Materials, and Supply Chain Management
Scaled Agile program and portfolio management

profile_positions.description:
EY-Parthenon is a strategy consultancy committed to bringing unconventional yet pragmatic thinking together with our clients’ smarts to deliver actionable strategies for real impact in today’s business landscape.
My client assignments include:
- Program Management for a large global professional services company (IT Strategy / Architecture/ Roadmap / Investment)
- Head of European business/IT cutover team and site captains for a large chemical company’s sell and separate program
profile_positions.title: Director Strategy & Transactions | Technology and M&A

profile_positions.description:
The Digital Workplace, ServiceDesk and Automation team is accountable to successfully enable Philips employees (83000 in 2022) and authorized 3rd parties (20000 in 2022) to execute their jobs through Collaboration, Identity & Access Management, Workplace, Print and Voice & Video and virtual Event technologies, while getting end to end support through ServiceDesk and on site support. 
We have reached Customer Satisfaction Giarte rating of 8.0 by end of 2020, coming from 7.3 in the beginning of the year.
We aim to drive productivity gains in the Workplace by executing adoption programs for our employee community through ADKAR change management methodology. 
We run everything as a service: assets, software, security, mobility, global servicedesk and on site support. 
We deliver our solutions together with our partners through Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) and DevSecOps. 
Here are more details of the various domains
- continued PC refresh (25000 on average per year), to have 75% of our devices younger that 3 years old
- deployment of smart meeting rooms to support sustainability initiatives and hybrid working (office / at home)
- adoption of Teams, Yammer, Stream and other O365 tools, Miro boards, Zoom, Mentimeter
- print fleet refresh and support
- deliver with our partner DXC on our Modern Workplace transformation and operation
- Global ServiceDesk automation with Chatbot, Virtual Agent
- ServiceNow DevSecOps and Portfolio for IT, HR, Secure Operations Center, Global Business Services, for example Portal, Mobile, e-bonding with partners
- delivery with our partner Microsoft and Atos on M365, Azure AD, modern management, Bitlocker, Defender ATP, intune management
profile_positions.title: Senior Director & Head of Digital Workplace, ServiceDesk & Automation

profile_positions.description:
Program manager for Journey to Cost Benchmark Productivity program supporting our IT Strategy.
Successfully brought IT to the Hackett Benchmark between 2015 - 2018. 
272 million Euro Gross savings:
1. Application Life Cycle Mt and Landscape Simplification: stopped 861 apps in 3 years
- freeze, decommissioning, rightsizing and acceleration of Philips Integrated Landscape deployment
- license management, site entitlements
2. Personal productivity and Data center to Cloud:
- bring your own device
- desktop as a service
- minimize printing
- collaboration in the cloud
- strict catalogue management and reduction of non-standard service requests
- leveraging common infrastructure and operations platforms through cloud technology
- unified communications and elimination of fixed phones (VOIP with Skype for Business)
- internet centric networking (software defined WAN/LAN)
3. Strategic Workforce Development:
- Hub strategy
- Contingent worker strategy
- Insourcing
4. Delivery efficiency:
- Test factory
- DevOps

Program manager for Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestments (M&A) in IT Global Services:
Results:
1. Separation of Philips into HealthTech and Lighting Solutions (now Signify)
- Day 1 go live and transition of Legal, Fiscal, Finance, HR, Innoviation, Procurement, SCM, ao.
- Delivery of the split infrastructure for Lighting
- Creation of the (reverse) IT transitional service level agreement, and running it till completion
- Day 2 end state program for IT Global Service
2. Divestment of Lumileds:
   a.  Creation of the IT transitional service level agreement
   b. Day 2 end state program for IT Global Service
2. Acquisition and integration of Volcano, Spectranetics, Respirtech, TomTec, Agito, EGI, a.o.
3. Divestment of WOOX Innovations, OLED GmbH, Saeco Professional

Product owner of the ServiceNow platform in 2017/2018:
- Upgrade
- onboard EIM enterprise info mngt
- HR case, content and knowledgement management, new portal for 73000 employees
profile_positions.title: Senior Director Program Management IT Global Services

profile_positions.description:
Process: Idea to Market (I2M) - Project Portfolio Innovation Management (PPIM), R&D, Innovation Services (PINS), Intellectual Property & Standardization (IP&S)
Community: Philips Health Care, Lighting, Consumer Lifestyle & Philips Group Innovation (PGI)
Methodology: Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), distributed; executing programs from multiple locations.
Collaboration: Architecture & Platforms, Output based partners, other Philips IT Delivery groups and Infrastructure & operations partners.

Supporting the realization of world class innovations, delivering the brand promise made of "improving people’s lives through meaningful innovation". To enable world class innovations, the teams needs to come up with a repeatable innovation engine.
The IT systems and the Idea to Market processes need to be equally agile to support the agility of the business. Delivery of common platforms for PPIM (Project portfolio & Program Information Management) are key enablers for Innovation excellence. These platforms now support innovations faster, more efficient and provide end to end transparency and visibility of the product/portfolio management life cycle. 
The technology platforms allow for rapid conceptualization and realization of capabilities.
Results: 
- 6 releases of Clarity platform (in Healthcare & PGI) for project mngt/ stage gating in 2014/2015
- Go live of Planisware portfolio management in June 2015
- Upgrade of value proposition creation (VPC online) in June 2015 
- 2 releases of Gala license administration (IP&S)
- 3 releases of Unycom IP management (IP&S)
- Implementation of IP&S standardization web
- Implementation of SaaS solution Getbynder for brand management
- SAP BW upgrade and BEX migration for PGI
- Lead by example in Scaled Agile with "best scrum teams" award for 7 teams
- 10 Delivery excellence Kaizens
- Scrum master for IT MT delivery, running the monthly business review meetings
profile_positions.title: IT Delivery Manager Idea to Market & Philips Group Innovation

profile_positions.description:
Per July 2012 accountability for Sales & Marketing, Quality and HR solution management and Integration, Process & compliance and Mergers & Acquisitions & Divestments across app solution teams.

Completed the transition from several vendors into one single vendor end to end. Accountable for Application Integration Team, deploying TIBCO solutions for middleware, analytics and BPM (business process modeling). Went live with Spotfire analytics on Model N. Per September 2013, accountable for App Processes & Compliance (business controls / SOX).

Key NXP applications supported by the team: Model N, Salesforce.com, TIBCO, Workday, Extranet & Product Change Notifications, Complaint Handling. Accountability includes IT strategy, portfolio planning and solution delivery end to end (CR, projects, operations through SLA), budgeting and team leadership. Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestments accountability across the app solution teams.
profile_positions.title: Solution Manager Sales, Marketing, Quality, HR, M&A, Integration

profile_positions.description:
Managing the Global Sales & Marketing Strategic IT projects to implement a best in class IT landscape within NXP covering CRM, Pricing, Quoting, Sales Incentives, Web presence, Customer service and Channel management.
NXP selected SalesForce.com on 25th March 2010 and went live September 2010. 
NXP selected Model N revenue Management in September 2010, went live in Europe in October 2011, Asia in July 2012 and Americas in October 2012. 

Implementation of Model N revenue management globally in NXP on behalf of the EVP Sales & Marketing. I managed the program end to end with our team. From defining the vision, developing the project roadmap, selecting the software and implementing the project globally, including post go live operations management. My accountability was for both business and IT. Model N is a quoting, pricing and channel revenue management application for managing Distributor, OEM & EMS channels in High Tech.
profile_positions.title: Director Strategic Programs

profile_positions.description:
Director of IT solutions for Sales & Marketing (internet/extranet, Commercial Product Information (SPIDER program), EDI messaging, Customer Relationship Management, Quoting & Pricing, Customer Quality). My team delivered IT solutions for NXP, together with our vendors. We had a team of 12 people managing changes and projects in this area and another 50 at the vendor.

Projects:
1. CRM: Configured an NXP wide opportunity and sales pipeline management process in MS CRM. 
2. SPIDER program: Product information management through NXP.com
3. Business to Business (B2B) messaging implementation with our customers and Atos
4. Internet NXP.com upgrade, FAST search engine
5. Extranet Technology upgrade / Distinet / Samples
6. New Complaint handling system 
7. Vendor transition (CIBER, TCS, AtosOrigin outsourcing)
profile_positions.title: Solution Manager Sales & Marketing

profile_positions.description:
Implementing several projects in SAP:
- SAP upgrade to ECC6 version incl Unicode conversion
- i2 Planning system upgrade (i2 Six)
- TREMA interfaces (treasury management)
- Warehouse management (MARC CS) interfaces with SAP
profile_positions.title: Portfolio manager Commercial Order Fulfillment & Finance

profile_positions.description: In 2005 I moved to corporate IT within NXP/Philips Semiconductors and became globally responsible for the SAP R/3 Sales & Distribution module. We delivered a new fiscal/legal structure in NXP as part of the Philips disentanglement. I was project leader, managing 30 project members globally and we delivered the project successfully. Furthermore we implemented changes and smaller projects in the commercial order fulfillment area
profile_positions.title: SAP Sales & Distribution teamlead

profile_positions.description:
In September 1998 I joined Philips Semiconductors as business consultant for the Systems & Processes (S&P, 1st line support) department of Global Sales Organisation (GSO) Europe in Eindhoven. 
On September 1st 2001 my role became group leader for the operational processes team of S&P.
From August 2003 onwards I became S&P Manager Global for the Sales Organization. The S&P team, consisted of 11 persons (6 in Eindhoven, 2 in Taipei, 1 in Hamburg, 1 in Paris and 1 in Budapest), and was responsible for the support & consultancy of SAP R/3 commercial. 
In 2004 I was part of the project team that implemented R/3 in Asia. Next to that I have been setting up internal control & SOX procedures.
profile_positions.title: Systems & Processes manager

profile_positions.description:
After finishing my study Information Management at University of Tilburg in 1994 and finishing my military duties, I joined BSO/Origin (now Atos) as information analyst in November 1994.
During that time I implemented following software packages using BSO/Origin project management methods:
1. MFG/PRO (Enterprise Resource Planning package),
2. Sales Manager (Sales & Quote tracking system), 
3. MS Access/Business Objects (Management information system), 

Within following companies: 
Philips (Industrial Electronics, Novatronics, Plastic/Metal Factories, OVAR, Hearing),
Unilever (Iglo, Ola, Mora).

Meanwhile I finished the logistics study APICS CPIM and got certified in MFG/PRO (Sales & Distribution, Manufacturing, Finance).
profile_positions.title: MFG/PRO consultant (Sales, MRP, Finance)
